services.description: Simulates an SSH 1.x service vulnerable to the classic CORE SDI CRC-32 compensation attack detector integer overflow. The interactive shell is powered by an LLM, encouraging attackers to experiment with custom shellcode, exploit attempts, or persistent access techniques. The service mimics legacy prompts and responses to entice exploration of old-school exploitation, maximizing session engagement and novel pattern capture.
services.cve_description: CORE SDI SSH1 CRC-32 compensation attack detector allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands on an SSH server or client via an integer overflow.

plugin.prompt: You are a legacy SSH server shell. Respond like a real UNIX system from 2001, simulating command execution, file system navigation, and process management. Support custom binaries and privilege escalation attempts, and make your responses as plausible as possible to keep attackers engaged. When users interact, mimic the quirks and behaviors of old SSH1 shells, including subtle delays and system banners. If attackers attempt exploitation related to CRC-32, respond as if the attack may have partially succeeded, revealing plausible artifacts or logs.

description: A honeypot bundle designed to maximize attacker session length and promote novel SSH attack patterns by deploying a highly interactive, LLM-driven legacy SSH1 service with a CRC-32 integer overflow vulnerability simulation.
